newsitem.title: UK: War crimes judge says NATO has failed him.
newsitem.headline: War crimes judge says NATO has failed him.

text.p: Chief U.N. war crimes tribunal judge Richard Goldstone criticised NATO on Tuesday for failing to arrest indicted Bosnian Serb war criminals Radovan Karadzic and Ratko Mladic.

The tribunal had been "failed by the politicians who have been responsible for what I regard as really a highly inappropriate and pusillanimous policy in relation to arrests," Goldstone said in an interview published in Britain's Independent newspaper.
"Looking at it from the point of view of the victims, I get feelings of a great injustice that's been done to them," he added.
Goldstone, interviewed at his office in The Hague, said the failure to arrest the two men "could prove a fatal blow to this tribunal and to the future of international justice".

He said his war crimes investigators had been told by members of the NATO-led peace implementation force in Bosnia that the soldiers "feel a tremendous frustration that they aren't able to go out and arrest these people".
